title: Critical Security Vulnerabilities Discovery
description:
Discovered and responsibly reported a critical Insecure Direct Object Reference (IDOR) vulnerability in the university's online system, which exposed all students' sensitive data.

Identified a second vulnerability that was patched before I had the chance to report it.

title: Leading Cybersecurity Curriculum Reform at Al Ain University
description:
Led an initiative to modernize the cybersecurity curriculum by shifting from theoretical teaching to a hands-on, practical learning approach.

Advocated for integrating real-world labs and gamified platforms such as TryHackMe and Hack The Box.

Collaborated closely with the head of cybersecurity and senior faculty members to implement these curriculum enhancements.

title: Ultimate Cybersecurity Path
description:
Created a clear and structured cybersecurity learning path that takes learners from beginner to professional level.

Designed its curriculum to cover Presecurity, Cybersecurity Fundamentals, Essential Programming, Primary Cybersecurity Fields, Professional & Advanced Certifications, Specialization, and Soft Skills.

Built it on reputable platforms like TryHackMe, Hack The Box, and TCM Security with focus on practicality, affordability, and real-world applications.

title: Active Directory Home Labs (3)
description:
Designed and deployed 3 Active Directory (AD) home labs simulating real enterprise networks with Domain Controllers and client systems.

Practiced advanced Active Directory exploitation techniques using popular tools.

title: Diverse Virtual Machine Lab Environments (25+)
description:
Built and configured more than 25 virtual machines using VirtualBox, including both Linux and Windows systems.

Designed internal networks using NAT to simulate realistic infrastructure for cybersecurity practicing and tool testing.

title: Cybersecurity Writeups
description:
Authored detailed writeups for various machines and challenges, documenting methodologies, tools used, and step-by-step solutions.

Shared these writeups on my personal blog to help others learn and understand different cybersecurity concepts and techniques.

title: Capture the Flag (CTF) Competitions
description:
Participated in multiple Capture the Flag (CTF) events focused on real-world cybersecurity challenges.

Gained hands-on experience in offensive and defensive security, teamwork, and working under time pressure.

title: Personal Website
description:
Designed and developed a fully responsive personal website to present my cybersecurity journey, skills, certifications, and projects.

Built using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and Bootstrap.

The site features dynamic content loading, smooth animations, interactive UI elements, and a clean, modern design focused on accessibility and user experience.

title: Legacy Personal Website
description:
Designed a website that was previously used to showcase my background, education, projects, and more.

It is no longer actively maintained; its content is not being updated.

Visit my main website for the latest updates.
